comments.body: Not tested but can `processingTimeSec` be zero?
I checked `processingTimeSec` can't be 0. It's calculated from `processingTimeMills`, which is the difference between the trigger clock of start and end of a trigger.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +191,195 @@        numInputRows = numRecords,
        inputRowsPerSecond = numRecords / inputTimeSec,
        processedRowsPerSecond = numRecords / processingTimeSec,
        metrics = sourceMetrics
      )

comments.body: When reset `"lastNoExecutionProgressEventTime =Long.MinValue"`, it will make `"now - noDataProgressEventInterval >= lastNoExecutionProgressEventTime"` always `true` when there is no new data. Then progress reporter will report an `empty` progress.
